department.ch: 工業管理研究所碩士班

goal.ch:
This course is to prepare students in Institute of Industrial Management (IM) for the research in the area of planning and scheduling. A student who has taken this course will be able to read scheduling literature, design the algorithms for solving the problems, and analyze the performance of the solving procedure. The content of this course is limited to the deterministic scheduling which accounts for only half of the textbook. Namely, the content regarding stochastic scheduling will not be covered in this course. Some typical scheduling problems in the environment of single machine, parallel machines, flow shop and job shop will be used to deliver the theory or concept in designing and analyzing the solving procedure/algorithm. General-purpose procedures such as Simulated Annealing, Tabu-Search and Genetic Algorithms will be introduced as well.
This course will be lectured in Chinese. Homework assignment is usually due in one week after the announcement; each student also needs to take lab section (IA5054).

outline.ch:
“Week (週次/日期) Topic (單元/內容)
1  Course introduction
2  Deterministic models: Preliminaries
- Framework and Notation, Class of Schedules
3  - Complexity theory
4  - Complexity theory
5  Single Machine Models (Deterministic)
6  Single Machine Models (Deterministic)
7  Single Machine Models (Deterministic)
8  Parallel Machine Models (Deterministic)
9  Parallel Machine Models
10  Midterm exam
11  Parallel Machine Models
12  Flow Shops and Flexible Flow Shops (Deterministic)
13  Flow Shops and Flexible Flow Shops (Deterministic)
14  Job Shops (Deterministic)
15  Job Shops (Deterministic)
16  No class
17  General Purpose Procedures for Deterministic Scheduling
18 Final exam
Coding project is required for this class and is accounted for 30％ of term grade. Each student will be asked to implement some algorithms in this class. The purpose of coding assignments is to provide students to get familiar with Python, data structures commonly used and the complexity of an algorithm. The coding assignment will depend on the background of students who register in this class; therefore, this will be decided during the class.
